title: My Mom's Awesome Macaroni Salad (enough to feed a crowd!)
ingredients: 2 (5 ounce) cans chunk light tuna in water, drained and flaked
instructions:
1. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook elbow macaroni in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until cooked through but firm to the bite, about 8 minutes; drain. Rinse macaroni with cold water until chilled; drain.
2. In a large bowl, mix mayonnaise, white vinegar, seasoned salt, sugar, garlic powder, and black pepper with a whisk until smooth. Stir in tuna, baby shrimp, cucumber, and sweet onion to coat ingredients completely, then add chopped eggs and stir.
3. Pour chilled macaroni into the bowl and stir. Top with sliced eggs and garnish salad with paprika.
4. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, preferably overnight before serving.
